## 판결문 요약

188 F.3d 71 (2nd Cir. 1999)
    THOMAS GARCIA, Petitioner-Appellant,v.HAZEL LEWIS, Superintendent, HALE CREEK CORRECTIONAL FACILITY, Respondent-Appellee.
    Docket No. 98-3733August Term, 1998
    UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALSSECOND CIRCUIT
    Argued June 2, 1999Decided Aug. 12, 1999
    
      Petitioner-appellant applied for a writ of habeas corpus under 28 U.S.C. §2254, claiming that his Sixth Amendment right to a public trial was violated when his mother's companion was excluded from petitioner's state court trial during the testimony of an undercover officer. The United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York, Korman, J., dismissed the petition on harmless error grounds, and petitioner-appellant now appeals. We affirm on the ground that an independent and adequate state ground of decision bars federal habeas review of petitioner's Sixth Amendment claim. [Copyrighted Material Omitted]
